issue.title: <coroutine> is freestanding, but uses std::hash which is not

discussion.p:
The <coroutine> header is required for freestanding implementations, but it defines a specialization of std::hash, which is not required for freestanding implementations.
Presumably we should make the std::hash specialization conditionally present.
Set priority to 3 after reflector poll. Would be resolved by for C++23, but it's still a defect in C++20.
This wording would resolve the defect for C++20, but the issue should be closed as Resolved in C++23.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to ISO/IEC 14882:2020(E).

ol.li: Modify as indicated: template struct hash>; -1- The specialization is enabled () in a hosted implementation.
